snippet: The Department of Homeless Services will devote more resources to “unsheltered homeless” people this year, allocating more than $45 million in city and state funds, up from $35.5 million the year before.
abstract: New York City's Homeless Services Dept will devote increased resources to address so-called unsheltered homeless, high-needs subset of more than 3,000 people who remain wary of traditional shelters; will allocate more than $45 million in city and state funds to issue.
lead_paragraph: The Department of Homeless Services will devote more resources to “unsheltered homeless” people this year, allocating more than $45 million in city and state funds, up from $35.5 million the year before.

headline.main: New York City Reaches Out to Homeless People Who Are Wary of Traditional Shelters
headline.print_headline: City Reaches Out to Homeless People Who Are Wary of Traditional Shelters
